f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:13): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317, in the Microdata examples section, several examples use itemtype="http://example.org/animals#cat", but then in the API section, you have another cats example using var cats = document.getItems("http://example.com/feline");
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:13): Is it intentional that these examples use different URLs?
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:36): is there a particular reason why negative values for r0/r1 in createRadialGradient throws instead of being clamped to 0?
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:39): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: off hand, no idea
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:39): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: off hand, probably that's what browsers did? dunno.
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:40): they don't all, and there is interop problems
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:40): gecko and webkit doesn't throw
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:40): hey, the validator stopped complaining about caption or whatever it was complaining about, sweet
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (11:40): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: also the same for fillRect
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:41): maybe they said they'd follow the spec? i dunno
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:41): see if there's bugs filed on them
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (11:41): it's been a few weeks since i looked at the canvas stuff
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:43): does opera throw?

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (11:45): will file a bug about the differing URLs after lunch, since it makes more sense for readers to keep using the familiar URL, rather than suddenly using a new random and unrelated one
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:47): Gecko seems to use abs(r)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:48): Webkit seems to clamp to 0
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:49): abs seems unexpected
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:49): Well anything is unexpected really
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:50): negative value is unexpected, a particular behavior when using a negative value doesn't need to be unexpected :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:52): I think either the gecko or webkit behaviour is fine. Throwing is evidently not (unless gecko and webkit are both prepared to change)
56ef338f9fcf9452fc833a005325025e (11:53): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: thanks for the pointer!
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:53): 2 out of 3 will have to change regardless

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:55): Yeah but the opera behaviour causes sites to just stop working. The gecko + webkit behaviours don't cause hard failure which, for some of the more decorative uses of canvas, is more important than the exact rendering

73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (11:59): "The behavior of the 'auto' value is user agent-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes." - http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/visufx.html#overflow
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (12:00): i had forgotten that the css spec sucks

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:07): wonders if Opera is going to start drawing the radial gradient circles at roughly the positions the user specified instead of making up something completely weird :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:07): (See e.g. diagram in http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-canvas-api/2009OctDec/0022.html)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:07): ((but ignore the "Correct interpretation?" because that's wrong, it should match WebKit))
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:08): s/WebKit/Safari/
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:12): also notes that it is totally non obvious that "INDEX_SIZE_ERR" would mean "value outside allowed range"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:12): Of course it is probably far too late to change that in general
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:13): Seems like the alternative is making up a new exception
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:14): which is harder work than reusing one that already has "size" in its name and is therefore not wholly inappropriate for size-related things
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:14): and just ignore the bit where it says "index"
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (12:14): man the ietf submission system is annoying
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:14): would hope browsers would print informative error messages to their error log before throwing the exception
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:16): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Well if you already know to ignore the misleading part then it is hardly misleading
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:16): It should really just throw RangeError() but I guess that would be too wasy
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:18): But that wouldn't work with such important cases as using the API from Java
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:20): Yes, like I said it would be too easy to have an API that works well with the only language avaliable in web clients

4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (12:20): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: are the issues on http://dev.w3.org/html5/status/issue-status.html that say "Review Change Proposal" issues that will at some point get a deadline for others to provide change proposals?
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (12:21): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: or are they things for which it is too late to provide alternatives?

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:21): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: they will all at some point get a deadline - and all unlisted issues will get a deadline to submit a Change Proposal in the first place
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (12:22): so -76 is the only one for which a deadline has passed?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:22): 4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317: none of them are too late to act on, though the chairs have not set any firm deadline for counter-proposals on any of them
4e528aa62dacc1d204b6b9a06e317317 (12:22): any idea what the timeline will be for -76?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): deadlines are about to pass for 7 and 63, which will cause them to be closed without prejudice if no one submits anything by tomorrow
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): for 76 a deadline has passed, and we now have two proposals on the table
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:23): I have not yet discussed with the other chairs what to do with the two proposals now

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (12:25): at the very least we'd probably give the Change Proposal authors some time to update their rationales in response to counter-arguments and each other's proposals
